The following table collects information about free and open source software ([FOSS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_and_open-source_software)) for spectroscopy.  Unless otherwise noted, the software mentioned here can be used with one or more of the following instruments: NMR, IR, Raman, ESR/EPR, fluorescence and UV-Vis.  Mass *spectrometry* software is not included here.  All information is taken from the respective websites and/or repositories.  Some softwares have been described in publications.  If so, a link is provided but keep in mind the document may be behind a paywall.

Software mentioned here appears to be regularly maintained, as evidenced by one of the following:

* a commit to a repository within the past year,
* a web site updated within the past year, or
* successful continuous integration.

Additions or corrections?  Please contact [hanson@depauw.edu](mailto:hanson@depauw.edu) or submit a pull request at the [repo](https://github.com/bryanhanson/FOSS4Spectroscopy).

[![Project Status: WIP â€“ Initial development is in progress, but there has not yet been a stable, usable release suitable for the public.](https://www.repostatus.org/badges/latest/wip.svg)](https://www.repostatus.org/#wip)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.com/bryanhanson/FOSS4Spectroscopy.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.com/bryanhanson/FOSS4Spectroscopy)

Abbreviations Etc:

* __EDA:__ Exploratory data analysis (unsupervised chemometrics)
* __R:__ A software environment for statistical computing and graphics [details, platforms](https://www.r-project.org/)
* __TEST__


```{r processValues, echo = FALSE}
# Additional processing of the input values
# Combine name and website to create hyperlink, incl pub if available
namelink <- paste("[", name, "](", website, ")", sep = "")
for (i in 1:length(namelink)) if (pub[i] != "") {
  namelink[i] <- paste(namelink[i], " ([pub](", pub[i], "))", sep = "")
}
```

```{r checkStatus, echo = FALSE}
# TO-DO
# Automatically check if the software is apparently kept up-to-date

status <- rep(NA_character_, length(name))

```


```{r createTable, results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
DF <- data.frame(namelink, descrip, lang, os, notes, status)
names(DF) <- c("name", "description", "language", "OS", "notes", "status")
kable(DF, table.attr = "class=\"sortable\"") %>%
  kable_styling(c("striped", "bordered", "sortable"))
```
